data.title: Don't Need to Drink to Enjoy LBC
data.text: I've now been to LBC twice and definitely plan to go back.  The Reuben Nachos, yes that's correct, were delicious.   Friendly staff and I understand the beers are good but cannot vouch for them. A very nice addition to Lakeville.

data.title: Finally a good restaurant in downtown
data.text: Downtown Lakeville has a shortage of good eating places. Lakeville Brewing helps fill this void. Wife has a basic cheese burger and thought it was really good. I had the fish and chips and it too was very good. We had two different locally made beers (a light beer and a stout) and they were very good. Place was busy on Friday evening and had a wide variety of customers. Service was good and waitress was very friendly. Will definitely go back.

data.title: Great local place
data.text: I've been here a few times now & have had great experiences every time!  The food is varied and I have not been disappointed by anything I have ordered. Dry rubbed chicken wings, reuben nachos & reuben sandwich are all delicious. Staff is very knowledgeable about the craft beers available 7 there are also other cocktails for the for the non-beer drinkers in your group. Prices are fair and reasonable. Don't for get the chocolate chip cookies!

data.title: First time visit
data.text:
I was there for a social gathering after a conference day.

I had a flight of their beers and they were decent. The red ale really stood out as well crafted. The up a was fine. The mull stout was quite sweet.

I had the black and blue tips to eat from the appetizer menu.  Quite good.

data.title: cool new brewpub
data.text: Great beers great food and friendly helpful staff! Its nice not having to travel downtown to get great food, drinks, and fresh brewed craft beer!

data.title: Nice beer selection and good food.
data.text: Nice beer selection. I had the Reuban, husband had the turkey burger. Both were very good. Good service.

data.title: Delicious food! Wouldn't expect that from a brewery.
data.text: Was there during Pan-O-Prog and the food was so amazing, I can't even believe it! The beer was good but what I remember more is the food. They were slammed but keeping up. The servers were very nice. And since it was Pan-O-Prog they had a band playing outside. I'll definitely be going back!

data.title: No ambiance, Loud, but Great beer and food
data.text:
We went to the Lakeville Brewing Company on a Saturday at 6:00 pm.  It was already packed and we had to wait about 20 minutes for a table.  The restaurant has very little ambiance, mostly because the lighting is stark and uninviting. Wait staff was attentive. The noise level was very high. We both liked our beer choice A LOT and we gave the beer a 9 (Wet Hop IPA.)

I had a pressed Ruben, which was very good.  It came with some limp french fries. Ruben was an 8 and the fries were a 4.

My husband had a Walleye Torta.  He said the fish was good but there was too much other things on it, drowning the taste of the walleye.  He also had sweet potato tater tots that would have been much better if the outside of the tots were crunchy.  The Torta was a 6.

We are excited to go back and try other offerings.  Next time, we will try a weekday hoping for less noise!

data.title: 1st time visit-We'll be back
data.text: I had their excellent brunch omelette, my wife had a very flavorful Reuben. We had bread pudding for dessert, very distinctive. Service was friendly and efficient. We'll come back and try their beer selection next time.

data.title: I wasn't impressed with the food.
data.text: I wasn't impressed with the food at Lakeville Brewing Company. My "luke-warm"  fish tacos didn't impress me. Actually, I didn't like their beer very much either. I'm sure there are better places to eat in Lakeville. It does have some charm. They do have a nice area outside for kids and adults to hang out. The service was good.

data.title: Remember The Name - Lakeville Brewery!
data.text:
It's ten percent luck, twenty percent skill, fifteen percent concentrated power of will, five percent pleasure, fifty percent pain and a hundred percent reason to remember the name! Ok, so I'm thinking that's not the actual percentages in making a successful business and I would think pleasure in your business would be much higher as well. But hey, what do I and Mike Shinoda (Fort Minor and Linkin Park) know about running a successful business anyways?

Well it doesn't matter because the owners at Lakeville Brewing Co. know exactly how to run a successful business and serving up some awesome brews and food, and they haven't been open very long. They have the perfect spot in downtown Lakeville where they're making their own story, making sure the kitchen and brewery stays up, which means when they put it down the towns' eatin' and drinkin' it up.

My wife and I stopped in briefly on a Friday night to pick up a donation from Lakeville Brewing for our Law Enforcement fundraiser we're hosting for Backing the Blue Line: Police Wives of Minnesota. While we were there, we decided to chat with one of the owners, Megan and have a quick flight of the new brews in town. There is nothing on their beer list not worth trying and their IPA is easily the best IPA in the entire Twin Cities area. So good!

Well, during our conversation with Megan and noticing all the food coming out around us, it was clear, by my drooling, that we had to come back and come back quickly. So quickly, that we were back 2 days later!

The menu has so many delicious things on it, but my wife and I settled on a couple of things that we chatted about just a couple days earlier with Megan. That was their House Burger and Tacos. Megan told us their fish tacos were insane, but I wanted to try all of their tacos and our server was kind enough to satisfy my taste buds and let me try one of each. Here's our thoughts on our cuisine.

The House Burger, topped with American, lettuce, tomato, greens, house made dill pickles and LBC sauce. A perfectly cooked, medium burger that was all-in-all a delicious burger. While my selfishness would like a bit more seasoning, there is nothing negative to say about their House Burger. You should definitely check this bad boy out and devour it like we did. Get the sweet tater tots to make your meal even better.

As for those tacos, if they were an authentic Mexican street style taco, these would have been near the top on our top ten taco list. As I stated, our server was kind enough to get me a taste of all 3 of their tacos - Fish, Steak and Pork. Lets break each of them down...
The Fish - fresh grilled flour tortillas with crispy cod fingers, fresh cilantro slaw, sweet chili sauce and queso fresco. Megan was right to brag about their fish tacos because the one I had wasn't enough.

The Steak - fresh grilled flour tortillas with blackened steak tips, fresh pico de gallo, queso fresco, crema and avocado. Perfectly seasoned, very tender steak and awesome!
The Pork - fresh grilled flour tortillas with crispy fried pulled pork, fresh cilantro slaw and sweet chili sauce. Some of the best pork found in a taco that I've had the opportunity to try and they're not found at a Mexican restaurant. They're found at a brewery! 

We ordered the fish sticks for our little guy and again, no one was disappointed, including our little guy. The tarter sauce that comes with is house made and absolutely delicious. So good, that I pushed the ketchup aside and used the tarter for my dipping sauce instead. Sadly for Mexican restaurants around town, this amazing brewery also serves better tortilla chips as well! Yummy! 

Lakeville Brewing is has become a definite go-to place for our family to go and enjoy some amazing brews and some outstanding food. I'm look forward to Friday fish fries in the Spring time and watching this place continue to be successful and grow.

data.title: Fun new addition to downtown
data.text: My husband and I went on a quick date here last Sunday. He had a sampler but unfortunately was only able to try a couple of the LBC beers but they were all good. I had a glass of Chardonnay which was not good but expected when you order wine at a brewery. Nice that they at least have the option to order wine as most breweries don't. I ordered fish tacos which was a huge order, heavy on the coleslaw but very good even though I'm not a huge coleslaw fan. I barely touched the tortilla chips and the salsa was very small for the amount of chips. My husband ordered the Reuben nachos which were really fun although they're served on really skinny pieces of rye bread so kind of hard to eat but still good. Our service was excellent. Just a little spendier than expected but overall a good experience.

data.title: Great Food and Cocktails, Ok Beer
data.text: I am sad we moved to TX not long after this place opened! The first time we went, it was the "soft" opening and they didn't have any of their own beer on tap. BUT, their cocktail menu was fantastic and the apps made up for it. LOVE the Reuben nachos. The portion is generous and it's delicious. We also went during Pan-O-Prog, and they were out of pretty much everything. We went again for brunch and loved it. There's a chicken dish on both the brunch and regular menu that is just awesome - I think it was a giant breaded breast with hollandaise, a biscuit, spinach, bacon....I'm not sure but it was delicious. I had the bacon and sausage that was fried in pancake batter (genius!). My only criticism is that the bacon wasn't crispy. Service has been consistently good and the decor is on point. Can't wait to visit!!

data.title: Great Beer and Food!
data.text: The beer is great, the food is great, the service went down hill after being seated.  Get there early on weekends.

data.title: Great food
data.text: Very good food and good beer selection. Not cheap but worth it. I had the brisquet and it melted in my mouth, not dry at all.

data.title: Lakeville Brewing Company
data.text: I had heard a good report on the food at this new Lakeville restaurant and was not disappointed. I had the brisket dinner which was tender, tasty and filling. My wife had a chicken dish that was served on biscuits with Hollandaise sauce.  Both great comfort foods and matched well with the selection of house beers.

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: After a bike ride we decided to stop for a beer and appetizer.  We like to patronize local businesses and we're excited to try a new place.  After being seated for quite some time, we asked for a waitress.  She came and said she didn't know we were in her section.  I asked for a water as we had been bike riding. We also ordered at the same time.  We received our order and no water. She was reminded and we waited.  No checking on our food. No water until reminded for third time and we asked for the bill.  Very disappointing.  She was working a lot of tables and seemed overwhelmed.

data.title: Great new restaurant
data.text:
We had dinner at the new Lakeville brewing company recently. The menu isn't large but offers great choices at expected prices. Service was very attentive, food delivery faster than anticipated and the taste was  simply great. Both of our dinners were prepared exactly as ordered and tasted fresh. Enjoyed the hand cut French fries too. 
Will definitely return soon and recommend this new option for wonderful food and craft beer in Lakeville!

data.title: Great new place trying to make it work.
data.text: Lakeville has this new brewery and restaurant to showcase the vibe in town. I think they are still trying to figure out how to make it the best in town. I'll give them credit for that. The beer are ok, one on the sample flight was "not good" we told the staff to confirm and they did. It was an off night for that beer. The others were ok. The food was good. The walleye torta with the sweet potatoes were amazing. As was the beef and blue cheese appetizer. My fried chicken was just ok.

data.title: A brewery without any beer
data.text: They ran out of their own beer.  The acoustics are awful.  The place was only half full and you couldn't hear yourself think.
